name: The Royal Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights in mid February using a KGB voucher. The staff were welcoming when we checked in and the room we were given was newly decorated. The only minor negative was that it was at the top of the stairs and that we could hear the footfall of guests coming and going.
reviews.title: Nice country hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The quality of the food served was good with reasonable portions. Dinner service was attentive. At breakfast there was a good selection at the buffet with a choice of cooked breakfasts offered.
reviews.title: Good, but some flaws.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is ideally located for walks in the woods and along the river all the way to Monmouth. We did not venture that far but may well visit Monmouth on foot at a later date. It is a place we would stay again when visiting the area in future.
reviews.title: not happy to honour voucher

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As with most of your reviewers I went to this hotel on a special Groupon offer - £85 for 2 nights B&B with a cream tea. Not the easiest place to find (thank you sat-nav!) but when you arrive it is a spectacular location right by the river. The reception was warm and we were assisted with our luggage. The room was a family room and so was a reasonable size. It's decor was very dated - woodchip wallpaper, and cables clipped to the skirting board. Amazingly there was no phone in the room, which together with the lack of a lift makes me doubt the 4star rating.
reviews.title: Great setting, great hotel

reviews.text: Many positives - extremely comfortable bed, good breakfast(lovely bacon and sausage) with lots of choice and one evening we ate in the restaurant where we had a superb meal at a reasonable price. We went at the end of March when "the weather would be warmer!" but of course it wasn't and most attractions were not opening until the start of Easter but that is no reflection on the hotel. They had two woodburning stoves which was very comforting, but the downside was that where we were -room 14 - when we opened a window for some freash air we got choked by fumes from the chimney close by.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great groupon deal. Bed and breakfast for friday and saturday. The room we were first shown to only had a shower so we asked if there was one with a bath available. We were kindly shown a couple of other rooms.
reviews.title: A lovely two day break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was fabulous.
reviews.title: Two Day Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great place for lots of walks and Goodrich Castle is a must.
reviews.title: Surprise, surprise!!

reviews.text: I am writing this review on behave of my parents. I bought the break on wowcher as a present. It included 2 nights B and B and cream tea for £99. They paid extra to take the dog! lol.
reviews.title: Hospitality ay it's best.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If slightly down at heel country hotel is your scene this is your dream. Set in the most beautiful countryside it is a very good base for walking or visiting the many attractions near by.
reviews.title: A pleasant country hotel

reviews.text: Service was usually good and the staff were helpful.
reviews.title: Easter weekend break
Sorry but not good vfm
reviews.text: Our room (9) was large but it could do with redecorating and a better wardrobe. It had a wash basin but strangely not in the bathroom/ toilet. The bathroom had a large bath with shower attachment. On the plus side there was plenty of hot water, and the central heating was good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very good with bread, croissant, meats including hand carved ham, juices etc. In addition you could order toast and afterwards you could order a cooked breakfast (?). The cooked breakfast was freshly cooked to order with decent sausages.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The evening meal was also very good but slightly expensive for what it was.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last weekend we stayed at The Royal Lodge Hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Wonderful views, friendly staff they couldnt do enough to accomodate you.
reviews.title: Everthing about this place is first class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was hearty and would keep you going for the day.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a cream tea on the Sunday which was yummy.
reviews.title: A Room with a View!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was a family room which would have slept 3 even though there was only the two of us. Very clean room and bathroom, lovely big towels and lovely and warm as it was a very cold weekend!!
reviews.title: Lovely family atmosphere

description: The Royal Lodge at Symonds Yat East has an idyllic setting in the heart of the Wye Valley in an area of outstanding natural beauty where the River Wye cuts a swathe through a wooded gorge on the edge of the spectacular Royal Forest of Dean.The Lodge is nestled just below Symonds Yat Rock and stands exclusively in grounds of almost 5 acres overlooking the river. It has terraced gardens of magnolia trees and a well established wisteria. The Royal was originally built in 1876 as a Royal hunting lodge and was converted to a hotel in the 1920's. It has had a full and extensive refurbishment in 2008 and is managed by Graham Howells who has overseen the transformation and ensures that the level of service reflects the new development and idyllic location. The Royal Lodge is a great place to unwind with long relaxing walks in outstanding scenery. The hotel is also well situated to explore the Wye Valley, Brecon Beacons, Black Mountains and the South Wales coast.
